Energy Turrets/Ammo

T2 Beam Crystals

Long range: Aurora
Short range: Gleam

(use gleam for slower/larger targets only)

T2 Pulse Crystals

Long range: Scorch
Short range: Conflagration

(use conflagration for slower/larger targets only)

Faction Crystals (Beam and Pulse)

Imperial Navy Multifrequency
(reduced range & overall damage output)

Imperial Navy Xray
(reduced range & increased thermal damage/cap need)

Imperial Navy Microwave
(increased range/EM damage/cap need)

There are a few other faction crystal types as well.

Energy Turret Details

  • Laser turrets are used primarily by Amarr ships.
  • Beam laser turrets are longer range, and pulse laser turrets are shorter range.
  • Laser turrets provide high damage against the weak natural resists of shields (all factions except most T2 Minmatar ships).
  • Laser turrets are weakest against strong natural resists of armor (All Amarr & Gallente ships).
  • Highest CPU requirement of all weapons.
  • Heat Sink modules increase lasers' damage and rate of fire.
  • Crystals: Long-range lose tracking/DPS. Short range gain tracking/DPS.
  • Low-slot heat sinks increase laser DPS.

Hybrid Turrets/Ammo

T2 Railgun Ammo

Long range: Spike
Short range: Javelin

(use javelin for slower/larger targets only)

T2 Blaster Ammo

Long range: Null
Short range: Void

(use void for slower/larger targets only)

Faction Ammo (Rails and Blasters)

Caldari Navy Antimatter
Caldari Navy Iridium
Caldari Navy Lead
Caldari Navy Thorium
Caldari Navy Tungsten

There are a few other faction ammo types as well.

Hybrid Turret Details

  • Many Gallente and some Caldari ships use hybrid turrets.
  • Blaster turrets are longer range, and Railgun turrets are shorter range.
  • Gallente is more suited to blasters while Caldari to rails (there are exceptions such as Hecate and Rokh, for example).
  • Hybrid turrets provide high damage against weak natural resists of shields (all factions except most T2 Minmatar ships)
  • Hybrid turrets have to be regularly loaded with fresh ammunition.
  • Long-range hybrid ammo lose tracking/DPS. Short-range hybrid ammo gain tracking/DPS
  • Low-slot magnetic field stabilizers increase hybrid DPS.

Missile Launchers/Ammo

Missile Launchers/Types

Rockets: Base 4.5km (13km)
Light Missiles: Base 19km (36km)
Heavy Assault Missiles: Base 7.5km (20km)
Heavy Missiles: Base 21km (40km)
Torpedoes: Base 9km (50km)
Cruise Missiles: Base 65km (200km)
Bombs: 30km AOE damage

Missile Damage Types

Electromagnetic (EM): Mjolnir
Thermal: Inferno
Kinetic: Scourge
Explosive: Nova

Many pilots use the faction versions.

T2 Light, Heavy, and Cruise:

Precision: smaller/faster targets (i.e. frigates)
Fury: larger/slower targets (i.e. cruisers)

T2 Rocket, Heavy Assault, and Torpedo:

Javelin: smaller/faster targets (i.e. frigates)
Rage: larger/slower targets (i.e. cruisers)

Missile Details

  • Missile range is determined by velocity and flight time (no falloff).
  • Missile damage is determined by velocity and sig radius of the target, and explosion radius, explosion velocity and damage reduction factor.
  • Missiles fire more slowly than turrets and have a travel time, but higher volley.
  • Launchers have a reload time. You can stop firing and reload at any time.
  • Faction ammo from least damage bonus to highest: Guristas, Caldari Navy, Dread Guristas.
  • Low-slot ballistic control systems increase missile DPS.

Projectile Turrets/Ammo

T2 Artillery Ammo

Long range: Tremor
Short range: Quake

T2 Autocannon Ammo

Long range: Barrage
Short range: Hail

Barrage is favored by many pilots, but has been nerfed.

Faction Ammo (Artillery and Autocannon)

Electromagnetic (EM): Republic Fleet EMP
Thermal: Republic Fleet Phased Plasma
Kinetic: Republic Fleet Nuclear
Explosive: Republic Fleet Fusion

There are a few other faction ammo types as well.

Projectile Turret Details:

  • Projectile weapons are used primarily by Minmatar ships.
  • Autocannons are short-range projectile turrets, and Artillery are long-range projectile turrets.
  • Projectile turrets have to be regularly loaded with fresh ammunition.
  • Autocannon turrets have short optimal ranges but very long falloff.
  • Artillery turrets tend to have the best alpha strike.
  • Tech II ammo produces only kinetic and explosive damage.
  • Low-slot gyrostabalizers increase projectile DPS.

High utility slot can have a NOS used at 6k.

High capacitor regeneration frigate.

Orbit at 3.5km with scram/web using Multifrequency/Conflag.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Scorch.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

Example Small Railguns

Weapon Range: 3-5.7km

Weapon DPS: 58 Volley: 177
Using Faction Ammo

Bonus to Small Hybrid Turret falloff
Bonus to Small Hybrid Turret damage
Reduction to Propulsion Jamming activation cost

Great range with up to 50% bonus to falloff. Meant to brawl, but makes a good scram kiter.

Blasters have better range with falloff bonus even beating autocannons on a Rifter hull.

Ion blasters and electron blasters can be used to allow a NOS/Neut in top slot, but are weaker weapons than neutrons.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at near 0km with scram/web.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Go toe to toe, or orbit at 7.5km and overheat scram using Null.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.

Condor

Caldari Tackle Frigate - T1

Shield Scram Kiter/Kiter

Max Missile Range: 42km

Moderate Tank

EHP: 2,000 - 5,500 | MWD Max: ~4,500 m/sec

Kinetic missile bonus
Light Missiles Likely
EM/Thermal Hole Possible
Light Missile Launcher II

Max Missile Range: ≤42km

Weapon DPS: 58 Volley: 497
Using Precision Light Missiles
Rocket Launcher II

Rocket Range: ≤8km

Weapon DPS: 83 Volley: 229
Using Faction Rockets

Bonus to Kinetic Light Missile and Rocket damage
Reduction to Propulsion Jamming system activation cost

Missiles have better range than rockets allowing Condor's to be great kiters well outside point range if needed.

Although there's a kinetic rocket and missile bonus, it's not enough to switch from using correct ammo type on targets.

Uses rockets for scram kiting and longer-range missiles for kiting.

Optimum Tactic:

Orbit at 20km with point.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 20km with point. Stay out of scram/web range at all costs and watch for slingshotting.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Keep at optimum and watch for slingshotting away from point.

Example Osmium Fit

Close

Incursus

Gallente T1 Combat Frigate

Bonuses to Armor Repairer
Bonuses to Small Hybrid Turret

Weapons Fit A: Light Neutron Blasters
Great to fit with a speedy hull (quite fast).

Weapons Fit B: Ion Blasters or Electron Blasters
This is very rare they are weaker weapons - tracking not much better.

Armor Tank - Brawler/Scram Kiter

Optimal: 1.1km Falloff: 4.2km

BLASTER DPS: 120 Volley: 270

Drones: 5Mbit @ 5m³

Armor: 562 | EHP: 4,200 | Velocity: 3,450 m/sec

This is the Gallente defensive version of the combat frigates.

No range bonus on blasters so a short optimal.

➵ Optimum is brawl using Antimatter at 1.5km with scram/web.
➵ Against brawlers will switch to null, and try to move to max scram range.
➵ Against kiters will try to slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.
➵ Assuming blaster fit, get to max scram range OR keep at range out past 9km.
➵ Typically an Explosive hole.

Merlin

Caldari T1 Combat Frigate

Bonuses to Small Hybrid Turret Damage
Bonuses to Shield Resistances

Weapons Fit A: Light Neutron Blasters
Possibly missles, but unlikely.

Weapons Fit B: Ion Blasters or Partical Accelerators
These are lower powered blasters.

Shield Tank - Brawler

Optimal: 1.1km Falloff: 4.2km

BLASTER DPS: 176 Volley: 397

Shield: 1,625 | EHP: 5,820 | Velocity: 3,110 m/sec

This is the Caldari defensive version of the combat frigates.

This is one of the slowest frigates in the game, so although powerful it can be avoided.

Do not underestimate it and get close. Will easily take out Confessors, Thrashers, Sabres, Hicates, etc. at 0km.

➵ Optimum is brawl using Antimatter at 1km with scram/web.
➵ Against brawlers will switch to null, and try to move to max scram range.
➵ Against kiters will try to slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.
➵ Assuming blaster fit, get to max scram range OR keep at range out past 9km.
➵ Typically an EM/Thermal hole.

Tormentor

Amarr T1 Combat Frigate

Bonuses to Small Energy Turrets

Weapons Fit A: Pulse Lasers
This is the basic fit.

Weapons Fit B: Beam Lasers
This allows 8km optimal. Uses an AB fit to counter tracking problems with beams and control range.

Armor Tank - Scram Kiter

Optimal: 4.3km Falloff: 8.1km

PULSE DPS: 143 Volley: 324

Drones: 10Mbit @ 20m³

Armor: 1,340 | EHP: 3,300 | Velocity: 3,000 m/sec

This is Amarr's offensive combat frigate. Does blaster DPS at 8km. May be the strongest FW frigate in the game.

Pulse lasers also get Scorch which gives the ship an optimal of 11km with a falloff of 13km.

➵ Optimum is to scram-kite using multifrequency at 4.5km with scram/web.
➵ Against brawlers will try to kite out to 13km with scorch and overheat scram/web.
➵ Against kiters will try to slingshot to get scram/web and stay under guns.
➵ Assuming pulse fit, get to 0km with cap pressure OR keep them at range out past 13km. Can shoot drones as well.
➵ Typically an Explosive/Kinetic hole.

Close

Tristan

Gallente T1 Combat Frigate

Bonuses to Small Hybrid Turret Tracking
Bonuses to Drone Hitpoints and Tracking

Weapons Fit A: Railguns
A setup to scram kite/kite.

Weapons Fit B: Light Neutron Blasters
A setup to brawl.

Armor Tank - Brawler>>Kiter

Optimal Kiter: 12km Falloff: 18km

RAILGUN DPS: 195 Volley: 454

Drones: 25Mbit @ 40m³

Armor: 743 | EHP: 3,650 | Velocity: 2,950 or 950 m/sec (AB)

This is the Gallente offensive version of the combat frigates.

The Tristan is so versatile, it can be fitted any number of ways. The kiting fit is one of the strongest in the game.

The Tristan is a brawling-type ship that can kite.

➵ If a brawling Tristan, get out of its range.
➵ If a kiting Tristan, close range and lock down.
➵ If a neuting Tristan, get outside of neuting range.
➵ Kill their drones as they provide most of the Tristan's damage.
➵ Fairly solid, but can be an Explosive hole.

➵ Assuming rocket fit, get to 0km OR keep them at range out past 11km.
➵ Typically an EM/Thermal hole.

Crucifier

Amarr EWAR Frigate

Bonuses to Weapon Disruptors

Weapons Fit A: Tracking Disruptors & Drones
Disrupts turret tracking range and/or speed.

Weapons Fit B: Guidance Disruptors & Drones
Disrupts missile range and/or precision.

Armor Tank

Range Support: 100+km Optimal

Drones: 15Mbit @ 45m³

Armor: 450HP | Shield: 250HP | Velocity: 350 m/sec

The ship can support light weaponry but gunnery dps is generally not a threat.

Typically they orbit at max range and keep tracking/precision disruptors and drones on the target while fleet kills them.

➵ EWAR cannot affect your drones.
➵ Get to your optimal (close in).
➵ Kill their drones if needed.

ROCKET DPS: 211 Volley: 337

Armor: 1.020 | EHP: 7,460 | Velocity: 2,284+ m/sec

The Vengeance is a tough ship.

This is a good set of bonuses. The damage and rate of fire for rockets helps the typically low DPS of rockets.

The downside is that assualt frigates are slow and there's no velocity bonus on rockets making it harder to keep up with faster targets.

➵ Optimum is to scram-kite at 5km with faction rockets against frigates or rage against destroyers and up.

➵ Assuming the rocket fit, fight to 0km with cap pressure OR best to keep them at range out past their 7.5km rockets. It's easy to get away as they're slow.

EWAR Range: 18km Optimal

DRONE DPS: 64.4 Volley: 257.4

Drones: 20Mbit @ 60m³

Armor: 531 | EHP: 250 | Velocity: 3,060 m/sec

The ships Neuts/NOS can drain as much as a medium mod with great range.

The damage output relies on drones, so it's fairly poor, but gives it large range.

➵ Optimum is to pull range, dry your cap, kill your range or tracking and whittle you down with drones.
➵ Against brawlers will try to kite out to 24km with overheated mods and kill your tracking.
➵ Against kiters will disrupt your range forcing you to get in closer. It will then attempt to stay under guns, and dry your cap.
➵ Assuming NOS/Neut fit, get close for more damage, use cap boosters if possible, and kill drones if needed (but generally a waste of time with three flights).

The fast Garmur can camp gates taking on cruisers that cannot keep up nor break the long point and missile range while they're out of DPS range.

➵ Optimum is to kite out at 35km outside of point and weapon range and kill drones if necessary.
➵ Against brawlers it will keep out at its normal kiting range.
➵ Against kiters will attempt to keep range with its tremendous speed. In some cases, with a point and scram, it can scram when a kiter comes close.
➵ With the missile fit and long range point, if not fast enough, the only chance you have is with drones or to slingshot and web/scram them.
➵ Typically an EM/Thermal hole.

While the Cormorant rules long range and the catalyst dominates brawling range, the Coercer is king of mid-range damage.

BLASTER DPS: 449.1 Volley: 920.4

The blaster Catalyst may have difficulty holding an opponent at close range with no web, but if it can, it unleashes massive DPS. Good in a gang where target is already tackled and it moves in to kill.

The falloff bonus allows a typical 0km brawler to become more of a scram kiter.

➵ Optimum is brawl using Antimatter at 1.7km with scram.
➵ Against brawlers it will likely beat another's brawling range, but can switch to null, and try to move to max scram range of ~7km.
➵ Against kiters it will try to slingshot to get scram and stay under guns of possible, but difficult as slow and no web.
➵ Assuming blaster fit, get to max heated scram range OR best to keep at range out past 10km. It should be easy to dictate range. Many have little to no tank.
➵ Typically an Explosive hole.

The Dargoon is a combo drone boat and Energy neutralizer designed to cap out the enemy.

While preferring to brawl with guns/drones/Neuts/NOS, it can also scram kite and still neut out to 8-10km as well as having a long drone range.

➵ Optimum is to go all in at about 4.5km having a solid buffer tank.
➵ Against brawlers will likely go toe to toe, but can move out to 8km with null while still applying cap pressure and drones.
➵ Against kiters will try to lure in but with low speed and range, it's a weakness. That said though, with range bonus its drones can still apply damage at long range.
➵ Assuming Rail/Neut/NOS fit, it's best to stay outside 10km and whittle them down (although they have a weak cap). You can kill drones as needed.
➵ Typically an Explosive/Kinetic hole.

The Vexor is a highly versatile ship with many fits ranging from brawler to kiting ship.

Optimum Tactic:

Scram-kite at 9km with overheated warp scrambler and speed tank using low signature bonus to their benefit.

Tactic Against Brawlers:

Orbit at 9km away from guns.

Tactic Against Kiters:

Slow with scram, hold with web if possible, and orbit closely under guns.
